text:
Manuel Lawrence Real (January 27, 1924 – June 26, 2019) was a Senior United States District Judge of the United States District Court for the Central District of California. He was appointed in 1966 by President Lyndon B. Johnson. He was the last remaining federal judge in active service appointed by Johnson.
He was the longest-serving active federal judge until his retirement in 2018.
Real died on June 26, 2019 in Los Angeles, California at the age of 95.
